articles.title: Gallery
articles.description:
A selection of the plots I made for #TidyTuesday. Find the whole list
[here](https://github.com/etiennebacher/tidytuesday).

articles.title: Etienne Bacher
articles.contents:
Etienne Bacher
          
          
          
          
          
          Research
          Blog
          Software
          Gallery
          CV
          
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Etienne Bacher
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                         GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                         Mastodon
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                         Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        

          
            
            
            
            I have recently obtained my PhD in Economics as part of
            the Doctoral
            Team Unit ACROSS at the Luxembourg Institute for
            Socio-Economic Research (LISER), Luxembourg. I focused on
            the relationship between cross-border mobility, attitudes
            and political preferences using both contemporaneous and
            historical data.
            I realized during my PhD that I prefer developing tools
            and creating datasets that other researchers can use rather
            than writing academic papers. Therefore, I am now looking
            for positions as a research
            software engineer or data scientist.
            I develop or contribute to many R packages, all of which
            you can find on my GitHub profile.
            I also write occasional blog articles about R and I have
            given some training on several topics, available in the
            “Software” tab above.
            If you want to contact me, the best way to do so is by
            email.
            
            
            
             Interests 
            Economics
            International migration
            Economic History
            Political attitudes
            R programming
            
            
             Education 
            
            PhD in Economics, 2020 - 2024 
            LISER, Luxembourg
            
            
            
            Master’s degree in Development Economics, 2018 - 2020 
            University Clermont-Auvergne, France
            
            
            
            Bachelor’s degree in Development Economics, 2017 - 2018 
            University Clermont-Auvergne, France
            
            
            
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Etienne Bacher

              and political preferences using both contemporaneous and

              I realized during my PhD that I prefer developing tools

              available in the “Software” tab above.

      Website created with the R package distill.

Research
Work in progress
“Populist leaders and international migration”
“Migrants’ voices”, with Martín Fernández
“Estimating the impact of xenophobia on immigration: evidence from terrorist attacks”, with Michel Beine and Hillel
Rapoport
Software
Patil, I., Makowski, D., Ben-Shachar, M. S., Wiernik, B., Bacher, E., Lüdecke, D. (2022), datawizard: An R Package for Easy Data Preparation and Statistical Transformations., Journal of Open Source Software, 7(78)

   Paper 
   Code 

Other

   Paper

Software
Tutorials & presentations





Webscraping with RSelenium


A tutorial on performing webscraping with RSelenium, 100+ slides.

See more





Webscraping with RSelenium (short)


A shorter version of the RSelenium tutorial, ~40 slides.

See more





Good practices for research with R



A small list of what I consider to be good practices for reproducible research with R, ~40 slides.
Get PDF


See more





Handling large data with polars and tidypolars


A brief introduction (not a tutorial) to the Python and R packages polars and tidypolars, ~30 slides.

See more




Packages





polars


Bindings for rust-polars in R. Built to be very similar to the python-polars API.

See more





tidypolars


Get the functionalities of Polars with the syntax of the tidyverse in R.

See more





altdoc


Use docute, docsify or mkdocs to create a website for your R package.

See more





prompter


This package allows to easily add tooltips to HTML elements in R Shiny applications. It uses hint.css under the hood.

See more





conductor


 Create tours in R Shiny applications using shepherd.js.

See more





R-JS adaptation


A list of all Javascript libraries adapted in R.

See more





shinyfullscreen


Use screenfull.js to put HTML elements in fullscreen in R Shiny applications.

See more
